IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: ESFA'S GRANTS FUND CLINICAL AND BASIC SCIENCE VISION RESEARCH AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA AT BIRMINGHAM, TRAINING FOR EYE CARE PROFESSIONALS, PUBLIC HEALTH EDUCATION ABOUT PREVENTIVE AND ROUTINE EYE CARE, AND INDIGENT CARE/OUTREACH TO UNDERSERVED CITIZENS OF ALABAMA.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO SERVE AS A CATALYST TO IMPROVE EYESIGHT THROUGH EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND ACCESS TO CARE.
IRS990.Description: GRANTMAKING TO THE UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA AT BIRMINGHAM, PARTICULARLY IN THE DEPARTMENT OF OPHTHAMOLOGY. IN THE LAST FISCAL YEAR GRANTS WERE AWARDED TO THE DEPARTMENT TO SUPPORT ITS EDUCATION(OPHTHALMOLOGY RESIDENCY PROGRAM) AND RESEARCH(CLINICAL AND BASIC SCIENCE)ACTIVITIES. GRANTS WERE ALSO MADE TO OTHER SCHOOLS AND DEPARTMENTS AT UAB. ALL GRANTS WERE MADE IN SUPPORT OF VISION-RELATED PROJECTS AND PROGRAMS, IN KEEPING WITH OUR MISSION. ALL GRANTS MUST STATE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES, AND INCLUDE METHODS OF MEASURING RESULTS. THIS INFORMATION IS DIFFERENT FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL GRANT.

Activity2.Description: GRANTMAKING TO THE EYE FOUNDATION, INC., WHICH INCLUDES THE CALLAHAN EYE FOUNDATION HOSPITAL. MOST OF THE SUPPORT FOR THE HOSPITAL IS GIVEN TO OFFSET THE BURGEONING COSTS OF INDIGENT EYE CARE AND THIS YEARS'S GRANT'S TOTALLED $400,000 FOR THIS PURPOSE, WHICH SERVED APPROXIMATELY 5,000 VISITS BY 3,300 PATIENTS, AND APPROXIMATELY 10% OF THESE VISITS RESULTED IN SOME TYPE OF SURGICAL PROCEDURE. A $495,000 GRANT WAS ALSO AWARDED FOR THE PURCHASE OF MUCH-NEEDED SURGICAL INSTRUMENTS AND EQUIPMENT, TO MEET THE OPERATING ROOM STANDARDS AND DEMANDS.

Activity3.Description: GRANTS TO THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION OF GREATER BIRMINGHAM SUPPORT A NUMBER OF EYE HEALTH CARE PROGRAMS OPERATED BY NONPROFITS IN THE BIRMINGHAM METRO REGION AND BEYOND. THESE GRANTS ARE MADE TO A FIELD OF INTEREST FUND HELD AT THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION, AND DISTRIBUTED AT THE DISCRETION OF THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION. EACH PROGRAM HAS SEPARATE VISION-RELATED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES, WITH METHODS OF MEASURING AND REPORTING RESULTS. PROGRAMS INCLUDE PROJECTS TO PROVIDE TELECOMMUNICATION DEVICES FOR DEAF/BLIND PERSONS, VISION SCREENING FOR SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN, PROVISION OF EYE GLASSES FOR INDIGENT PATIENTS, AND REHABILITATION ACTIVITIES FOR MILITARY PERSONNEL WITH EYE INJURIES, AMONG OTHERS.

ActivityOther.Description: GRANT TO ALABAMA GIVING, A PROFESSIONAL NETWORK OF FOUNDATIONS WITHIN ALABAMA WITH WHOM WE COLLABORATE. GRANT TO ST. VINCENT'S EAST FOUNDATION IN SUPPORT OF THEIR ANNUAL HOLIDAY ART CONTEST FOR VISUALLY IMPAIRED SCHOOLCHILDREN WHICH HELPS RAISE FUNDS FOR THE LIZ MOORE LOW VISION CENTER AT ST. VINCENT'S EAST. GRANT TO YOUNGLIFE (BIRMINGHAM) IN SUPPORT OF PROGRAMS DEALING WITH YOUTH.

Name.BusinessNameLine1: ST VINCENT'S FOUNDATION MEDICAL CENTER EAST

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE SET ASIDE TO SUPPORT SPECIFIC PROGRAMS THAT IMPROVE EYESIGHT THROUGH EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND ACCESS TO CARE.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Foundation has been determined to be exempt from federal income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. The Foundation adopted FASB ASC 740-10, Income Taxes, for the year ended June 30, 2010. The Foundation files a tax return in the United States (U.S.) federal jurisdiction. The Board of Trustees has evaluated the Foundation's tax position and concluded that the Foundation has not entered into any events or transactions that would disqualify its tax-exempt status or has not taken any uncertain tax positions that would cause the Foundation to incur income taxes or penalties at the entity level. With few exceptions, the Foundation is no longer subject to U.S. federal tax examinations by tax authorities for years before 2006.
CHANGE IN UNREALIZED GAIN ON INVESTMENTS

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: TO SUPPORT VISION PROGRAMS (EDUCATION, RESEARCH, OUTREACH)
TO SUPPORT INDIGENT CARE AND SURGICAL INSTRUMENT PURCHASE
TO SUPPORT VARIOUS EYE HEALTH PROGRAMS IN THE COMMUNITY
TO SUPPORT YOUTH PROGRAMS IN BIRMINGHAM (OUTREACH)

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: APPLICANTS SUBMIT A WRITTEN PROPOSAL WHICH GOES THROUGH A COMPETITIVE GRANT REVIEW PROCESS AND RECOMMENDATION BY OUR GRANTS COMMITTEE AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD. GRANTEES SIGN A LETTER OF AGREEMENT OUTLINING THE TERMS OF THE AWARD. STEWARDSHIP REPORTS WITH OUTCOMES MEASUREMENTS ARE PROVIDED YEARLY, AND FOUNDATION STAFF PERFORM DUE DILIGENCE AND SITE VISITS DURING THE TERM OF THE GRANT. FINANCIAL REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED AT THE END OF THE GRANT (AND EACH YEAR FOR MULTI-YEAR GRANTS) AND UNUSED FUNDS ARE RETURNED.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: FAMILY MEMBER OF TRUSTEE MIKE CALLAHAN
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: KEY EMPLOYEE OF INVESTMENT ADVISOR FIRM.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CLARENCE B. BLAIR, TRUSTEE AND DUNCAN B. BLAIR, TRUSTEE:FATHER/SON HALL W. THOMPSON, TRUSTEE AND MICHAEL D. THOMPSON, TRUSTEE:FATHER/SON WILLIAM C. HULSEY, TRUSTEE AND DUNCAN HULSEY, TRUSTEE:FATHER/SON

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 4
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE EYESIGHT FOUNDATION OF ALABAMA, INC. ADOPTED NEW BYLAWS AT THE OCTOBER 2009 MEETING OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: STAFF INCLUDING EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF PROGRAMS, AND BUSINESS MANAGER, COLLABORATE JOINTLY, GO THROUGH THE FORM 990 ITEM BY ITEM, TO PRODUCE REQUIRED RESPONSES AND PROVIDE TO THE CPA FIRM, WHO HANDLES OUR TAX RETURN. THE CPA'S DRAFT IS THEN REVIEWED BY THE STAFF AND ANY DISCREPANCIES OR QUESTIONS ARE RESOLVED WITH THE CPA FIRM. ONCE SIGNED, THE 990 IS MADE AVAILABLE TO ANY TRUSTEE TO REVIEW, UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OUR EXPANDED CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY WAS ADOPTED DURING OUR YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2009, AND IS STILL IN IMPLEMENTATION. TRUSTEES ARE COMPLETING THE REQUIRED CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS, WHICH WILL BE ON FILE IN THE FOUNDATION OFFICE. THESE FORMS WILL BE UPDATED EACH YEAR AT A MINIMUM. ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS WILL BE DISCLOSED PRIOR TO ANY VOTES AT BOARD AND COMMITTEE MEETINGS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH YEAR THE STAFF PROVIDES TO THE BOARD AN ANNUAL REPORT ON THE STATUS OF OUR WORK AS COMPARED TO GOALS/OBJECTIVES SET FORTH IN THE STRATEGIC PLAN PREVIOUSLY APPROVED BY THE BOARD. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR PROVIDES TO THE BOARD CHAIR PUBLISHED NATIONAL AND REGIONAL COMPARATIVE SALARY INFORMATION FOR FOUNDATION EXECUTIVES AND STAFF MEMBERS. THE CHAIR AND/OR EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR SOMETIMES CONSULT WITH OTHER LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE SIMILAR TO ESFA TO ASCERTAIN COMPARABLE SALARY LEVELS AND TRENDS. THE CHAIR AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR DISCUSS PERFORMANCE ISSUES, BOTH FOR THE ED AND OTHER STAFF MEMBERS. THE CHAIR MEET IN EXECUTIVE (CLOSED) SESSION WITH THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE TO DISCUSS AND SEEK APPROVAL OF ANY INCREASES IN COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. MINUTES ARE KEPT OF THESE PROCEEDINGS AND DECISIONS. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR DISCUSSES RECOMMNEDATIONS FOR STAFF INCREASES WITH THE CHAIR AND HAS ULTIMATE AUTHORITY FOR THOSE DECISIONS. ULTIMATELY, LETTERS REGARDING ANY SALARY INCREASES ARE WRITTEN TO EACH EMPLOYEE AND KEPT IN THE PERSONNEL RECORDS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 AND A SUMMARY OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT FROM OUR MOST RECENT YEAR ARE POSTED ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE. OUR ANNUAL REPORT, WHICH APPEARS AS A SECTION OF OUR NEWSLETTER, IS ALSO POSTED ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE. OUR GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND COMPLETE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS CAN BE INSPECTED AT THE ORGANIZATION'S OFFICE BY APPOINTMENT OR PROVIDED UPON REQUEST.
THERE HAVE BEEN NO CHANGES FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

NameOfDisregardedEntity.BusinessNameLine1: THE UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA AT BIRMINGHAM

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: SURGICAL EYE CARE AND PROFESSIONAL TRAINING
